::KitKat::

She was still tired, but her mind was still working, somewhat.
She got up and stretched. She went over and printed out the analysis 
that the computer had worked out so far.  She studied the DNA 
signature and chemical compositions of the spark.  She walked around 
the room, looking at the print outs and studying them.  She noticed 
where the DNA was missing for the correct skin pigmentation.  She 
also noticed that the spark, even though it had energy, it was 
lifeless.  She looked up from the papers and stared at the the wall. 

"That means then, the body must have a remote control to it some how. 
Or the brain was programmed to act a certain way.  But somewhere, 
there had to be a remote control for it."(let me know if this theory 
is correct on the clones. I don't know a whole lot about cloning, so 
if I get this wrong, please correct me.)

She studied the DNA again and wondered if there was something she was 
missing.  The only thing that was really missing, was the body.  
She wondered that if she had the whole body to analysize, she shook 
her head and disregaurded that thought.  The body was in almost 
totally destroyed and what ever she would have wanted for study was 
gone.  She then turned and looked at the spark.  It sparkled a bit 
under all the lazars. She sighed and sat back down, waiting for 
Destructor to some and tell her the replicator was finished.
